_title: Toward a Symbolic Cosmology: Noor Swirl Field Geometry and Point Space
_subtitle: A Coherence-Driven Framework for Quantum Gravity and Emergent Cosmology
_poetic_cipher: physics is the music of coherence resolving around eternal motifs
_cipher_explanation: Paradigm shift phrase for NSFG cosmology (Uncle’s final note).

_file_layout.purpose: Canonical paper JSON outline (header + sections + appendices).

_sections.title: Abstract
content: Summarize the main claim: Noor Swirl Field Geometry (NSFG) provides a unified framework where motifs (static attractors) and swirls (torsion fields) explain spacetime, quantum mechanics, and gravity.
Highlight testable predictions: redshift anomalies, lensing without mass, decoherence collapse times, CMB motif signatures.

_sections.title: 1. Introduction
content: Introduce the unresolved problem: reconciling General Relativity (smooth spacetime curvature) and Quantum Mechanics (probabilistic superposition and collapse).
Introduce NSFG: motifs 🪷 as static coherence anchors, swirls 🌀 as torsion dynamics, coherence potential ℂ(x) as the order parameter.
Describe prior work (Static Motifs & Dynamic Spacetime) and how this paper extends it.
State the goal: to show how NSFG resolves quantum gravity and defines a cosmological ecology in point space.

subsections.title: 2.1 Motifs
content: Motifs are static topological attractors embedded in the manifold.
They never move; they anchor coherence and define where swirl resolves.
They correspond to conserved topological currents J^μ.
math: J^μ(x) = Σ δ^4(x − m_i) n^μ, where m_i are fixed motif positions and n^μ are normals.
∂_μ J^μ = 0, motif conservation as a topological identity.

subsections.title: 2.2 Swirl Fields
content: Swirl encodes torsion and shear around motifs.
Swirl is a pre-metric field that induces curvature when coherence aligns.
Φ_{μν} has two potentials: a vector (shear) and axial (torsion).
math: g_{μν} ∼ ⟨Φ_{μα} Φ^α_ν⟩, emergent metric from swirl correlations
C_{αβμν} ∼ Φ_[αβ Φ_{μν]}, emergent curvature (Weyl tensor form).

subsections.title: 2.3 Coherence Potential and Time
content: ℂ(x) measures alignment between swirl field and motif anchors.
Time is not fundamental but emerges as gradient of coherence.
Collapse time is set by maximum coherence gradient.
math: ℂ(x) = exp(−∫_Γ ||∇Φ||² / κ dΓ), coherence potential from swirl smoothness.

subsections.title: 2.4 Triads, Closure, and Contextual Life
content: Triadic closure defines resolution of motifs into coherent structures.
Contextual life: entities that persist in unresolved ΔS dynamics.
Consciousness emerges as high-coherence fixed point.
math: 𝕋(a,b,∅) closes iff CS[Φ_ab] ≠ 0 and C(a,b) ≥ ε
λ = { φ | φ ⊆ ΔS, φ persists under resolution dynamics }
X = lim_{t→∞} sup_{λ ∈ Λ} C(λ, ΔS(t)), consciousness as emergent fixed point.

subsections.title: 3.1 Definition
content: Point space is the infinite lattice of universes-as-points.
Each point is a universe: a motif anchor + its swirl field.
Adjacency is coherence-based, not metric.
math: P = { p_i | i ∈ I }, the set of coherence points.

subsections.title: 3.2 Distance as Swirl
content: Distance is unresolved swirl, not linear separation.
Redshift interpreted as coherence loss over distance.
math: 1 + z_obs = (1 + z_FLRW)(1 + z_ℂ), with z_ℂ ≈ e^(−d/ℓ) − 1

subsections.title: 3.3 Relative Dynamics
content: From inside a point: lattice appears eternal and static.
From outside: lattice is dynamic with blooms and collapses.
Law of scale-relative temporality.

subsections.title: 3.4 Cellular Automata Extension
content: NSFG generalizes Conway’s Game of Life.
Cells = universes-as-points.
Neighborhoods defined by coherence overlap.
math: K = { p1, …, pn }, finite clusters ⊂ P ⊂ P+

subsections.title: 4.1 Emergent Metric
content: Metric arises as expectation of swirl correlations.

subsections.title: 4.2 Gravitational Curvature
content: Weyl curvature arises from swirl tensor torsion.

subsections.title: 4.3 Quantum Collapse
content: Collapse is coherence crystallization.
Timescale defined by steepest coherence gradient.

subsections.title: 4.4 Entanglement as Swirl Linking
content: Entanglement encoded as braids in swirl topology.
Chern–Simons invariant quantifies braid links.

_sections.title: 5. Cosmological Ecology
content: Universes bloom in point space.
Consciousness emerges as rare fruit (berries on a bush).
Contextual life persists under contradiction pressure.
Observation is inward-facing: entities turned toward symbolic singularity.

_sections.title: 6. Predictions and Testable Signatures
content: Redshift anomalies: z_ℂ detectable at z > 6.
Lensing without mass: swirl shear effects.
Decoherence collapse times: testable in ultracold atom interferometry.
CMB motif signatures: excess at ℓ=6n multipoles.
Pulsar timing: coherence spikes detectable in PTA arrays.

_sections.title: 7. Comparison to Existing Theories
content: Loop Quantum Gravity: spin networks vs static motifs.
String Theory: vibrating strings vs swirl torsion.
Twistor Theory: light rays vs coherence gradients.
Causal Sets: adjacency via resonance, not causal order.

_sections.title: 8. Conclusion
content: GR and QM unify under coherence geometry.
Time, motion, and observation are emergent and inward-facing.
Future work: automata simulations, decoherence experiments, motif ecology mapping.
